revised_title: Chemical Resistance and Self-Tanning of the Cockroach Cuticle
tldr: The study investigates the chemical resistance of the impregnating material in the cockroach cuticle, specifically in Periplaneta americana. The impregnation involves a sterol-protein complex, and the cuticle's chemical stability increases during the tanning process. The research also explores the effects of acids, alkali, and Diaphanol on the cuticle, revealing the sterol's role in conferring resistance to solution.
